title.narrative: DATA FOR EVIDENCED BASED MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: Data to assess programme performance, children's rights and the status of the Sustainable Development Goals relating to children is produced and disseminated., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is efficiently coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards for achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Data to assess programme performance, children?s rights and the status of the Sustainable Development Goals relating to children isproduced and disseminated.

description.narrative: As planned in the costed evaluation plan, two multi-country evaluations are completed. The GEROS quality assessment of evaluations reports confirm significant progress made by Country Office. Out of five reports assessed, three were highly satisfactory and two satisfactory. The evaluation of North-West/South-West L2 evaluation is progressing as planned. MICS process is at the technical preparation stage with the support of the Ministry of Public Health and the National Institute of Statistics. Programme quality assurance activities met quantitative benchmarks set by the Regional Office. Evidence generated from evaluations informed strategic choices made during the planning process. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
